rules_or_instructions: GENERAL INSTRUCTIONS
Product Specific Instruction:
1. After dispensing of propofol, soyabean oil and egg lecithin nitrogen sparging should be done in container headspace and sealed it tightly.
2. CIP/SIP processed filters (8.0 micron PP) shall be used for each batch as per respective SOP.
3. Store the bulk solution under nitrogen blanketing during hold time study.
4. Inline mixer having rotor configuration shall medium- fine – very fine generator.
5. During filling pre and post flushing of nitrogen (Headspace oxygen in vials should be not more than 3%) shall be carried out.
6. After completion of recirculation of mixing phase, immediately transfer to manufacturing vessel MV-2000-2 Loop 2 for homogenization.

7. If transfer delayed, then keep the bulk solution under nitrogen blanket and stir the bulk solution at 100-200 rpm at every 30 min for 10 min. Before transfer to MV-2000-2 stir the bulk solution at 100-200 rpm for minimum 10 min.
8. Initial 5.0 Ltrs solution filled in buffer tank shall be discarded prior to filling.
9. During any breakdown or stoppages of filling machine (more than 30 min), discard the initial approx. 100-200 mL (Equivalent filled vials) from each filling nozzle.

rules_or_instructions: 5.0 PROCESS FLOW DIAGRAM
Schematic P & ID for Process

The diagram illustrates a process flow involving several large cylindrical tanks and processing equipment. The flow starts at tank MV-200, which has a line leading to an inline mixer. The output of the inline mixer goes to tank MV-2000-1. From tank MV-2000-1, the flow continues to a heat exchanger. After the heat exchanger, the flow goes to tank MV-2000-2. From tank MV-2000-2, the flow goes to an SPX Homogenizer. Finally, the flow ends at tank MV-2000-3. Various pipes, valves, and instrumentation (like level sensors) are shown connecting these components.

The output of the inline mixer goes to tank MV-2000-1. From tank MV-2000-1, the flow continues to a heat exchanger. After the heat exchanger, the flow goes to tank MV-2000-2. From tank MV-2000-2, the flow goes to an SPX Homogenizer. Finally, the flow ends at tank MV-2000-3. Various pipes, valves, and instrumentation (like level sensors) are shown connecting these components.

Process flow diagram showing the manufacturing process for Propofol Injection. The flow starts with tank MV-200, goes through an inline mixer, then tank MV-2000-1. From there, it goes through a heat exchanger, then tank MV-2000-2, then an SPX Homogenizer, and finally tank MV-2000-3.

rules_or_instructions: 5.0 PROCESS FLOW DIAGRAM
Recirculation & filling Assembling
Steps:
Holding/filling vessel: Recirculation of emulsion shall be done during storage at every 3 hrs for minimum 10 min. through pump.
Filtration: The emulsion is passed through 8.0 µ PP Clarification filter prior to the filling machine.
Filling & Sealing: Filling of vials with pre and post nitrogen purging (NMT 3% headspace oxygen) stoppered with rubber stopper & sealed with flip off seal.
Terminal sterilization: At NLT 121°C with 15 minutes.
Terminal sterilization with Steam sterilizer (Sterilization at NLT 121°C with 15 minutes)

rules_or_instructions: VIAL DECARTONING, WASHING AND DEPYROGENATION ACTIVITY
Visual Particle Matter Test details:
Frequency: Perform clarity check of washed vials at the start of operation, Take sequential head washed vials for in-process check and ensure the satisfactory results as per SOP No. PAP-SM-045.
Acceptance Limit: The WFI should be free from visible particulate matter.

Note: If any visible particulate matter observed, repeat the test. If the test fails again then identify the problem and rectify it and start vial washing after successful completion of visual particulate matter test.
Inspection booth ID No.: PA-5M-005
#After clarity check, destroy the vials.
